chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Make False Statement in Title

result.execSummary:
The defendant Queena L. Metcalf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Make False Statement in Title, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 342.06(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Cash bail applied.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

- NO CONTACT with Willie Johnson.
- No possession of illegal drugs.

charges.descr: Knowingly Make False Statement in Title

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Queena L. Metcalf

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Queena L. Metcalf in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Queena L. Metcalf.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days served. Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  No contact with Willie Johnson.
-  No possession of illegal drugs. 
- Provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief.

Defendant Queena L. Metcalf in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Queena L. Metcalf.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR CHANGE OF COURT DATE.

Defendant Queena L. Metcalf in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Queena L. Metcalf in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Queena L. Metcalf and Ian Vance-Curzan appeared by video means. Defendant could not pass COVID screening to appear in person.  Case in court for a plea hearing, however parties are requests more time for continued negotiations. Court will set one final plea hearing, if case does not resolve Court will set case for trial. Case is adjourned in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Queena L. Metcalf in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests projected guilty plea date. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Queena L. Metcalf in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense request additional time. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Queena L. Metcalf in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont; both appear by video.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Slomczewski.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defense given a copy.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Arraignment scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered the $500.00 to be returned to the remitter.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Willie.J. (dob 11/17/1988).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Queena L. Metcalf in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOESp QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/19/22 @ 1:30p
Actual Date Bond Posted with  Milwaukee County Sheriff on 12/05/2021.
